name: The Flex Company
headline: Sustainable period care.
description: The Flex Co. is the top-selling sustainable period care brand known for creating a more comfortable period for everyone. Their patented product portfolio, Flex‚Ñ¢ Disc, FlexCup‚Ñ¢, Softdisc¬Æ and Softcup¬Æ, which are sold online and in over 30,000 retail doors throughout the U.S. including Walmart, Target, CVS and Walgreens. Based in Venice, California, The Flex Co. is the sole manufacturer of its products, which are designed and produced in the U.S. and Canada.  Led by founder & CEO Lauren Schulte Wang, our team is working to create life-changing experiences through the products we make and conversations we spark. Learn more at flexfits.com.

founders.name: Lauren Schulte Wang, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Lauren Wang has spent over a decade building leading consumer brands for companies including Coca-Cola, Upwork and IBM. Lauren frequently speaks on the topics of women‚Äôs health and entrepreneurship, and has been featured in TechCrunch, OZY, The New Yorker, WIRED, The Washington Post and NPR. Lauren is the first in her family to graduate college, working full-time while earning her business degree from Georgia State University. Follow her on Twitter @lmschulte and Instagram @laurenschultewang

The Flex Company, often referred to as The Flex Co., is a notable player in the sustainable period care market. Founded in 2015 by Lauren Schulte Wang, the company kicked off its journey as part of Y Combinator‚Äôs Batch S16, which is a prestigious startup accelerator. Since then, it has grown rapidly, boasting a team of 28 passionate employees based in Venice, California.

The core mission of The Flex Company is refreshingly simple yet impactful: to provide sustainable, comfortable period care for everyone. Their product lineup includes innovative solutions like the Flex‚Ñ¢ Disc, FlexCup‚Ñ¢, Softdisc¬Æ, and Softcup¬Æ, all designed with comfort and sustainability in mind. These products are sold online and are now available in over 30,000 retail locations across the U.S., including major retailers like Walmart, Target, CVS, and Walgreens.

As the sole manufacturer of its products, The Flex Company takes pride in producing them in the U.S. and Canada, ensuring quality and safety standards are met. Their offerings are even eligible for HSA/FSA, making them an accessible option for many.

The essence of The Flex Company is nicely encapsulated by its founder‚Äôs personal journey. Lauren emphasizes that the motivation behind Flex was to create a better experience during menstruation‚Äîher mantra being, "Don't blame your body. My body wasn‚Äôt to blame. My products were." This reflects a broader goal to spark meaningful conversations about menstrual health while delivering products that enhance comfort and reduce period-related challenges.

For those looking to explore sustainable period care solutions, The Flex Company has positioned itself as a trustworthy and innovative leader in the space. You can learn more and check out their products at [flexfits.com](http://www.flexfits.com). 

In a world where conscious consumerism is becoming the norm, The Flex Company stands out not just for its products, but for the change it seeks to foster in the industry.
